clinical_study.brief_title: The Neural Correlates of Cannabis Use
clinical_study.official_title: The Neural Correlates of Cannabis Use

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to determine the temporal course of recovery of CB1R availability and neural oscillations, in cannabis-dependent individuals at baseline, following 48 hour confirmed inpatient abstinence and after four weeks confirmed abstinence. This research will also examine associations between CB1R availability, neural oscillations and cognitive function.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to determine the temporal course of recovery of CB1R availability and neural oscillations, in cannabis-dependent individuals at baseline, following 48 hour confirmed inpatient abstinence and after four weeks confirmed outpatient abstinence (confirmed by tracking creatinine adjusted urine THC-COOH levels). This research will also examine associations between CB1R availability, neural oscillations and cognitive function using [11-C]OMAR PET imaging and electroencephalography.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in CB1R availability from baseline to 48 hours and 28 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Cognition during withdrawal using CogState
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in CB1R availability from baseline to 48 hours and 28 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in brain rhythms measured by Electroencephalography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in CB1R availability from baseline to 48 hours and 28 days

arm_group.description: Subjects who are frequent cannabis users
Subjects with no current or past major medical or psychiatric history

intervention.description: The radiotracer, [11-C]OMAR will be administered at no more than 10 micrograms at the beginning of each PET scan.

biospec_descr.textblock: When specimens and information are stored, researchers are careful to try to protect your identity from discovery by others. Samples and information will receive a unique code. Other researchers will only receive coded samples and information, and will not be able to link the code to subjects. Strict security safeguards are in place to reduce the chance of misuse or unplanned release of information.

study_pop.textblock: Research subjects can be both cannabis-using or non-cannabis using males and females between the ages of 18-35.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Cannabis Dependent Subjects
- Current cannabis consumption
- Positive urine screen for cannabinoids (and negative for all other drugs)
- No other illicit substance use during the past three months
- Willing to abstain from cannabis use for four weeks
- Daily cannabis use
- Greater than 2 year history of regular cannabis use
- Diagnosis of DMS-V cannabis dependence
- 1000 lifetime exposures to cannabis
Inclusion Criteria for Healthy Controls
- Lifetime cannabis exposure less than 20 times
- No cannabis use in the past two years by self-report
- No history of illicit substance use and a negative urine drug screen
Exclusion Criteria:
- Nicotine dependence
- Diagnosis or family history of Axis I or II disorders other than cannabis dependence/abuse
- Current or past DSM-V neurodevelopmental disorders, schizophrenia spectrum disorders, bipolar and related disorders, anxiety disorders, obsessive-compulsive and related disorders, trauma-and stressor-related disorders, dissociative disorders, and neurocognitive disorders except cannabis dependence
- MRI metal exclusions and claustrophobia
- Positive urinary cotinine levels at time of scanning
- Education completed is less than 12 years
- Family history of Schizophrenia or Bipolar Disorder
- Consuming more than twenty-one alcoholic beverages per week
- Significant neurological disease
